snippet: Many Americans who signed up through the federal marketplace for health care coverage have yet to receive an insurance card, policy number or bill.
abstract: Patients across the country are having difficulties with insurance policies bought under the health care reform law, which went into effect on Jan 1; in addition to problems many face in proving they have coverage, patients are also having a hard time figuring out which doctors are affiliated with their plans, and often doctors themselves do not know.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH
byline.contributor: Robert Pear reported from Fort Worth, and Abby Goodnough from Washington. Anemona Hartocollis and Reed Abelson contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Many Americans who signed up through the federal marketplace for health care coverage have yet to receive an insurance card, policy number or bill.

headline.main: Enrollees at Health Exchanges Face Struggle to Prove Coverage
headline.print_headline: Enrollees at Health Exchanges Face Struggle to Prove Coverage

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
